Package com.shouldis.bitset.random

Class DensityRandom

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.random.Random
com.shouldis.bitset.random.DensityRandom
public final class DensityRandom
extends Random
Implementation of Random which generates bits with a specified Hamming-weight ratio using a sequence of bitwise AND and OR operations. This class combines multiple random words to create words with each bit having an expected average density, within some tolerance to the desired density.

Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and Random.nextBoolean() will use this algorithm to generate bits with the specified density, while the other methods retain the behavior of Random.

In uniformly distributed random fields of bits, each bit will have a 50% chance of being in the live state. This class derives a sequence of AND and OR operations such that operating uniformly-distributed fields of bits against each-other in that sequence produces a field of bits with density within 2-(n +1) of the desired value in the range [2-n, 1 -2-n], where n is the number of operations, or depth. Between a uniformly distributed field of bits, and a second field of bits with a density d, an AND operation will result in density d/2, and an OR operation will result in density (d +1)/2.

Given a desired density and depth, an estimation can be created in the form of a fraction, wherein the numerator is round(2depthdensity), and the denominator is 2depth. A depth can be derived from a tolerance value by -log2tolerance. Reductions can be found using floor(log2numerator); that number of reductions can be safely subtracted from depth, and divided from the numerator, resulting in an equivalent fraction. The estimated density can then be reconstructed as numerator/2depth. The sequence of operations used to generate bits with the specified density is then equal to the numerator bit-shifted to the right by 1. Traversing the sequence one bit at a time, from least significant toward most significant, stopping after depth number of bits. Starting with a uniformly-distributed field of bits, when a live bit is encountered, an OR operation is performed against another uniformly-distributed field of bits, and when a dead bit is encountered, an AND operation is performed.

The underlying pseudo-random number generator Random has a period of 264 -1. This generator consumes multiple elements of that sequence with each call to Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and every 64th call to Random.nextBoolean(). As a side-effect of consuming multiple elements of the sequence with each call, it is possible to reduce the period of the sequence by a factor of depth if it is a divisor of 264 -1 such as 3, 5, 15, 17 or 51.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
Random

  • Field Details

    • density

      public final double density
      The density of words generated by Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and the rate at which Random.nextBoolean() returns true. Integers will have on average (density * 32) bits in the live state, and longs will have (density * 64) bits in the live state, with each generated bit having a chance equal to density to be in the live state.

    • depth

      public final int depth
      The depth, or number of operations performed in order to achieve an estimation of density. This value is bounded to the range [1, Long.SIZE) by boundDepth(int), resulting in an accuracy of up to 2-64.

    • sequence

      private final long sequence
      The sequence of operations used to operate uniformly distributed random bits against each-other in order to generate specified density.

  • Constructor Details

    • DensityRandom

      public DensityRandom​(double density, int depth, long seed)
      Creates an instance of DensityRandom with the specified density, depth, and seed. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. depth will be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, Long.SIZE).

      Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and Random.nextBoolean() of this DensityRandom will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

      Parameters:
      density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
      depth - how many operations to perform in order to estimate the desired density.
      seed - the value to initialize the sequence of pseudo-random numbers with.

    • DensityRandom

      public DensityRandom​(double density, int depth)
      Creates an instance of DensityRandom with the specified density and depth. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. depth will be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, Long.SIZE).

      Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and Random.nextBoolean() of this DensityRandom will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

      Parameters:
      density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
      depth - how many operations to perform in order to estimate the desired density.

    • DensityRandom

      public DensityRandom​(double density, double tolerance, long seed)
      Creates an instance of DensityRandom with the specified density, tolerance, and seed. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. tolerance will be used to compute a depth, which will then be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, Long.SIZE).

      Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and Random.nextBoolean() of this DensityRandom will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

      Parameters:
      density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
      tolerance - a percentage used to describe the distance that is acceptable to have between density, and the value it is estimated to.
      seed - the value to initialize the sequence of pseudo-random numbers with.

    • DensityRandom

      public DensityRandom​(double density, double tolerance)
      Creates an instance of DensityRandom with the specified density and tolerance. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. tolerance will be used to compute a depth, which will then be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, Long.SIZE).

      Random.nextInt(), nextWord(), and Random.nextBoolean() of this DensityRandom will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

      Parameters:
      density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
      tolerance - a percentage used to describe the maximum distance that is acceptable to have between density, and the value it is estimated to.

  • Method Details

    • nextWord

      public long nextWord()
      Description copied from class: Random
      Returns the next pseudo-random long from this random number generator's sequence. Values returned are not meant to represent numerical values, and instead represent a field of bits.
      Overrides:
      nextWord in class Random
      Returns:
      a randomly generated long word.

    • toleranceDepth

      public static int toleranceDepth​(double tolerance)
      Computes a depth corresponding to the specified tolerance. tolerance will be bounded by boundPercentage(double), to ensure it is a valid percentage used to describe the max acceptable distance between a DensityRandom's density, and the value it is estimated to.
      Parameters:
      tolerance - the percentage to transform into a depth.
      Returns:
      the required depth to ensure the generated bit's density is within tolerance of the specified density when creating a DensityRandom

    • powerInverse

      public static double powerInverse​(int power)
      Efficient method of computing 2-power doubles.
      Parameters:
      power - the desired power of the resulting double.
      Returns:
      a double representation of 2-power.

    • boundDensity

      private static double boundDensity​(double density, int depth)
      Ensures that the specified density is within the acceptable range depending on depth such that it will fall in [2-depth, 1 -2-depth].
      Parameters:
      density - the density which will be bounded using the specified depth.
      depth - the max number of operations used to estimate density.
      Returns:
      density bounded within [2-depth, 1 -2-depth].

    • boundPercentage

      private static double boundPercentage​(double density)
      Ensures that the specified density is within the range [0, 1].
      Parameters:
      density - the value to bound, representing the desired ratio of live bits to dead bits.
      Returns:
      density bounded within [0, 1].

    • boundDepth

      private static int boundDepth​(int depth)
      Ensures that the specified depth is within the range [1, Long.SIZE).
      Parameters:
      depth - the value to bound, representing the max number of operations.
      Returns:
      depth bounded within [1, 63].
